Reviews.Title: “great localization for budget travels”
Reviews.Author: lt1976
Reviews.Content: excellent localization, 2 min from St Marco, 1 min from the motorboat, easy access from airport and station, good price for budget travels, but we got a very very cold room. My GF got cold after first night. There was a heating system in the room but it heated only the air for a bit (walls very cold, no central heating system) and it worked with pauses...in the pauses it was cold. The breakfast (tea, coffee, honey, butter, cereals, milk and bread) was decent for a few bites before going to the city. The staff was great, nice people.

Reviews.Title: “a bargain, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Netski66
Reviews.Content: My mum had stayed here twice in the past and highly recommended it because of its exceptional price - only 90E a night for a double room (shared bathroom) - and location. It's a few minutes' walk from St Mark's and close to the canal boat stops (easy access to the train station and airport). While it is a little daggy and down-at-heel; with the classic old Venetian florals, heavy dark wood furniture, a creaky/uneven staircase and hard bed and pillows, we didn't mind. It's a super-old building and it's amazing that anything in Venice is till standing really! The owner/manager Nicos, his brother and sister are charming, speak a few languages and are happy to answer questions, guide and help you. There's a great late night eatery called Bacchus nearby, excellent for an emergency panini or vino. The view out of our window onto the canal, and hearing the gondoliers singing along on a regular basis, was a highlight; so romantic and amazing for a first-time visitor. The slightly surly late night doorman doesn't do them any favours though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean comfortable rooms, nice breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Whitleys2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at Albergo Doni. The B &B was easy to find, and minutes from St.Mark's square. It has a lot of charm too. We stayed in a very romantic room that faces the canal - we could hear the gondeliers in the evening as they passed by. The room had a shared bath which was decent (the toliet was separate). The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was typical Italian, very plentiful, and the seating area was cute. The owner gave us a tremendous recomendation for Pizza at Antica Sacrestia - very authentic and some of the best we found in our entire 5 weeks of travel. You can't beat the price for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and central”
Reviews.Author: kirmorrison
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for exploring Venice. Room was basic but fine - and nice to hear gondoliers singing beneath the window. Staff pleasant and friendly. Don't wear socks walking in the halls or to the bathroom though as floors were pretty slippy and I managed to have a bit of a nasty fall. Pillows are hard so was glad to have taken another traveller's advice on bringing my own travel pillow. Breakfast basic - cereal and a roll - but fine to start the day... On the whole though a nice place to stay for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Bare necessities, right by San Marco, good for solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: JLevine84
Reviews.Content: For the solo traveler who only intends to be in the room to sleep, I would recommend staying here. The single room would not fit more than 1 person if attempted. A ceiling fan kept the room at a decent temperature at night (when it was about 72-75 degrees outside) although I am not sure how adequate it would be during a heat wave. 3 single rooms shared 1 bathroom on the floor. About a 2 minute walk to the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop. About a 5 minute walk to the Grand Canal. Not a bad price (60 Euros a night) considering the Redentore holiday weekend. Be prepared to pay in cash. Breakfast included yogurt, juice.

Reviews.Title: “Other than location nothing good”
Reviews.Author: GodfreyHk
Reviews.Content: If the location and the rate is your only concern otherwise please find another hotel

Reviews.Title: “A terrific little hideaway in the heart of the Castello neighborhood...”
Reviews.Author: redwinterTucson
Reviews.Content: It's old and a little tired but very homey and well priced and felt like the Venice I knew 25 years ago. The gondoliers sing outside your windows every morning as they prepare their boats for the day's work and you're only a few steps away from San Marco, San Zacarria, good shops, and a host of wonderful restaurants. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovelly way to discover Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Ambassadeur_Risoer
Reviews.Content: With the gondolas stationed outside the hotel, greeted by classical music and a classic reception with clear memories of past times Hotel Doni welcomes you!. Hotel Doni is a hotel that has a star placed under its name, and perhaps it is wise, not becouse it doesn't deserve more. No only becouse in that way you will get a pleasant surprise on your arrival. The breakfast at the hotel are enjoyed in the dining hall by the reception area, no channel view since the windows are too high on the wall. They serve simple breakfast rolls and marmalade, honey etc. There is juice, coffee and tea at the breakfast table. The staff at the hotel are service minded, speaks very good English and seems to have really good local knowledge of Venice. The hotel's location is priceless, I would say quite optimal, at least for the price you pay. With about 300m to St. Mark's Square, 200m to the nearest "boat bus" stop. It gives you the feeling of being in the heart of Venice! You are surrounded by canals, alleys and shops, restaurants and sights. But one thing should be borne in mind - service at the hotel seems to be quite unique. The feeling of being welcome is not quite present in many of the restaurants and shops of Venice. The city is a must for history interested, in fact for any traveler. And the city shall be enjoyed from the back streets and alleys. Perhaps rather than from the gondolas in the canals. It is certainly a fantastic way to see the city or it ishould I say live the city, but it is also an expensive pleasure. Perhaps the "boat buses" is the best option for you, just remember your camera and also stand in the open part of the boat for the best pictures. When in Venice, please remember one thing; Enjoy life! And a good base for this could be Hotel Doni(Albergo Doni)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location although a little dated, but a great budget choice”
Reviews.Author: anelyn00
Reviews.Content: The Doni is perfectly located just a quick walk away from St Marks Square and theGrand Canal. It is wonderful to stay here instead of the mainland if you are looking for a budget priced room. It allows you to explore Venice later at night or early in the morning when all the crowds/tour groups have not yet arrived. The room we stayed in was pretty dated and the attached bathroom very small, but functional. The breakfast was basic - cereals, juice, tea (not so good) and coffee. However, when there is so much lovely italian food to eat outside, this is not really a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Charming Small Venice Pensione”
Reviews.Author: SofiaJoe
Reviews.Content: We have been staying here since 1989, and have never been disappointed. It is on a tiny canal, right next to one of the most expensive hotels in the city, with singing gondoliers going by, steps from the Grand Canal and St. Mark's Square. I can't imagine why anyone would waste their Venice vacation staying in Mestre on the mainland when they can economically stay in the heart of the most romantic city in the world. Hotel specifics, walk up the stairs in this well cared for building that is hundreds and hundreds of years old, and you will find charming rooms, some with their own bath and some down the hall. They also have a nearby 2 bedroom apartment for rent which we enjoyed on our last visit. Probably our favorite hotel in our favorite city. Just don't clog it up when we want to go there, please. :-)

Reviews.Title: “On a budget? Perfect location and charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: StevenJames87
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, simple but pretty dÃ©cor. Comfortable rooms and beautiful view over the canal. A couple of minutes walk to St Marks Square. Fantastic location for budget travellers. Right in the heart of Venice

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great location & value for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: KendallAnne
Reviews.Content: My friend Kate and I traveled to Italy in April 2011 and chose Hotel Doni for it's price and location. We found Hotel Doni in the Rick Steves Italy guide book and it was the perfect choice for our Venetian vacation! The directions to the on the website from the train station were easy to follow and the hotel is just a three minute walk from the S. Zaccaria water bus station. It is located very near Saint Mark's squareâ€¦a perfect location for exploring Venice! The hotel staff was extremely friendly and always smiling. They gladly helped us find an ATM and gave us good, affordable restaurant recommendations. They also helped us plan our very early morning -- 3:30 am -- trip to the airport. Our room was on the third floor and was very charming with antique furniture and a picturesque view of one of Venice's cute, narrow canals. In the early evening we had a prime view of a parade of gondolas and lovely echos of singing gondoliers and according players playing for tourists. We shared a bathroom on the second floor (toilet and shower) but also had an in-room sink and bidet. The room and bathrooms were a bit dated but clean. As others have mentioned, the towels are very small, but knowing this ahead of time, we made sure to bring a travel towel and robes to walk comfortably from our room to the shower. The bed, while hard as a rock, was surprisingly comfortable! The pillows were also very hard, but luckily we brought travel pillows that made it okay. We might have just been really tired after long days of sightseeing but we slept wonderfully! The floors were wooden and creaky but there was never any noise loud enough to bother us or disrupt our sleep. The breakfast was completely adequate for us, offering coffee, pastries, cereal, bread and an assortment of jams and butter. Overall, we loved Hotel Doni. It was a great value for it's location and we heartily recommend it to budget travelers!

Reviews.Title: “It was really nice! So, nur kann man sagen: Gut!”
Reviews.Author: gaudiii
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room, with the view to the Canal, it was really nice! and the Staff is really very polite and kind! Always I saw a smile! That is great!!! :D The breakfast is ok, tea, milk, cocoa, coffee and little bread with marmalade and butter, jam too. It's nice. The room was really nice, ok old but, so is the style from Venice and traditional. The hotel is located really near to the Piazza San Marco, you can go there many times during the day, if the weather isn't good. We appreciate, when the women in front the desk offered to us a pair of umbrellas!!! Oh! It was really charming! ;) (Thank you for this detail, this day was raining and cold, but Venice is always beautiful under low other high Temperatures. Again about the room, only, maybe the pillows could be better ;) they were so hard. Next time, we'll there again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Central & Charming”
Reviews.Author: Kardoesie
Reviews.Content: Once I left the watertaxi and the canals behind me, I got a bit lost on my way to the albergo, but once arrived I was welcomed warmly at the front desk by Nikos. My room was ready and was located on the third floor â€“ a bit of a climb, but my suitcase was light. The hotel is decorated in a charming style. The room was spacious with a view on the canal. Although a basin is located in the room, and the toilet was located directly opposite, the bathroom was a bit of a walk (in your robe) two floors down. I was warned that the towels are small, but they were changed after two days. The hotel is very centrally located â€“ probably the best value for money you can get so close to St Markâ€™s square. The staff can also direct you to a closeby supermarket where you can buy bottled water and supplies. I must have covered 80% of Venice on foot. Food is really affordable and the cicchetti was a feast â€“ twice a day. South African rands do not stretch far, but food and drinks were cheaper in Venice than Paris. Spritz is THE drink to order in Venice and in fact, the whole if Italy. Breakfast is substantial with fresh fruit, juice, tea, coffee, cereals, milk, bread, mortadella (cold meat), cheese, chocolate spread and jams. The supplies were topped up during breakfast. The staff were very helpful with advice of what attractions to visit and where to eat. Lucky is a lovely dog! I loved my view on the canal, the breakfast and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmmmdeedee
Reviews.Content: Good thing is it in the mix with everything that is Venice. The only drawback I would say is that it is totally in the middle of Venice. That is bad probably only for me due to it's large crowds. Since we went in October, it was rainy and windy. That meant St. Mark's square was flooded. They quickly put up catwalks but they too were crowded with walking tours, tourists, and people just trying to get around. Good thing is, it's right in the middle of things. Right in front of the Vaparettos that will take you to the other islands and back to the main for not very much money. +-3 euro? Yes, towels were like loofa sponges. No lift because it's a historical building. Fortunately we were on the 1st (2nd in American standards) floor. Nikolaus helped us up on our way in but don't expect that when you go. Breakfast was okay. You find a lot of breakfast cereals and bread while in Europe. Just a fact. I drank a lot of orange juice which was fresh. Overall it's another budget hotel, which they do not hide from that fact, that you have to take the good with the bad. PS: The owners live downstairs so I thought that was kind of cool. Oh, when we were there also, windows were left open during the day due to probably mildew issues. That allowed mosquitos to get in to which I am allergic. One day I had to stay in due to an overbloated face and lips. If you are allergic to any type of bug, just let them know to keep the windows closed.

Reviews.Title: “Casual and friendly with a great location”
Reviews.Author: JDPSanFrancisco_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doni for 5 nights in Sept. 2010 and was very comfortable there. Asked for a quiet room and was given one on a courtyard which was fine. Room was spacious, staff were friendly and available, location is very handy to San Marco attractions...and the vaporetto stops. Downside: the towels are thin but usable. Breakfast is skimpy:cornflakes, hard rolls, thin ham slices, drinks. I recommend the Doni for first time Venice visitors but for me, and other return visitors, I would prefer a less central more neighborhoody area....Castello or Dorsoduro.

Reviews.Title: “ItÂ´s an old place but with a very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: JoseLuisRdz
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an amazing location... but to be honest I think it cost so much than they offer. My room has -in and old closet- two used bottles of scotch and vodka (maybe of the previous guest). For the same price I get a room in a two stars hotel with A/C, TV and internet. An d a friend get other hotel with similar services but for 40 euros. I have to mention that the staff of Albergo Doni was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly english speaking staffs.”
Reviews.Author: summerwow10
Reviews.Content: Was there for 2 nights in summer. Place was easy to find if u follow the map on Doni's website. I came via the Alilaguna( water bus) from the airport, aligned at San Zaccaria jetty, one stop from San Marco which is only 500m away and found the hotel in the alley within 5 mins. I stayed in a single room shared bathroom, no canal views but looking into small courtyard, in a sense better coz of the stench from the canals in such hot weather. As mentioned by the other travellers, the towels are small but adequate for only 2 nights. It was really hot and humid, there's a ceiling fan but could probably do with something stronger. Breakfast is included but really really basic- plain bread roll with jams, spread, cornflakes, tea, milk and coffee only. Location is excellent! All in all, great friendly budget hotel (Venice standard) suitable for the budget conscious and couples, not so for family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: KseniyaG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 5-minute walk from San Marko square - perfect location. We shared the bathroom, which never caused long waits and it was clean. Our room was very spacious and included a sink; however, you could easily hear the neighbours next door and downstairs. The breakfast was below average, only biscuits with jam and 2 types of cereal; coffee wasn't very good. All in all, it was a great value for the money, considering its location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: amyhearttravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than a 5 min walk to St. Mark's Square. The location is perfect. My room had a canal view, which was nice, and at no extra cost. The room is nothing fancy and had a shared bathroom. The bathroom was available when I needed to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Friendly Hotel in Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: chrish574
Reviews.Content: Simple but wonderful. We enjoyed our stay at the Albergo Doni. The staff is so friendly. We were 3 adults and a baby and and we loved our room. There was a small bathroom and a fresco on the ceiling and plenty of room. Very charming. And the breakfast was very nice. But the best part is the location- SO CLOSE TO ST. MARK'S SQUARE!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hosts and great location”
Reviews.Author: Maimeo
Reviews.Content: We arrived early morning after a cruise. The Doni was easy to get to by Vaparetto from P. Roma. Nikkos arranged to have our room cleaned early and stored our luggage while we went out for coffee. Our room was spacious for the three of us and the rollaway for a fourth person would not overcrowd the room. The bedding and pillows are very firm, the linens are not soft, and the lighting is very dim. Breakfast was modest but adequate (coffee, tea, juice, cold cereal, rolls with jam and honey, and sliced cheeses and meats if you were an early riser). While the hotel could use fresh paint, it was clean and the hospitality of Nikkos and his family was outstanding. Very close to San Marco and the Doges palace. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hostel, perfect location, no nonsense”
Reviews.Author: vmaasalo
Reviews.Content: Looking for a nice, clean, functional place to stay for a few nights? Albergo Doni is a one-star hostel in a perfect spot, just off Venice's center of power (San Marco) and very close to a vaporetti stop. Some reviewers comment on the lack of amenities -- well, it only has one star, so it delivers what it promises. I stayed for three nights in a single room and have no complaints whatsoever. Well except for the gondola singers rowing past -- not all of them were Carusos -- but that's not the hostel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tinyshoe
Reviews.Content: Great location, very near st mark's square and all major attractions. We got a room with a very cool 17th century alfresco on the ceiling. Only problem is, the rooms are very badly lit, not good for reading at night. There's no television as well. Don't follow the website's map! Google earth it!! We followed the map and got hopelessly lost when it was only just 2 mins away from s. zacaria (?) valporatta stop! Breakfast was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location but..”
Reviews.Author: emarin78
Reviews.Content: My GF and I went to Venice for a Week and got a great deal at El Doni for the weekend.The location and staff were great.We moved to a nicer hotel b/c after walking all day,we wanted to relax in a nice room.I would recommend this place to people that are on a budget and are only there for a day or two. The breakfast was ok, not great and it can ran out. The bathroom was ok, but anytime someone flushed the toilet you would hear it.One thing that I didn't like was that you had to leave your room key at the hotel and ring a bell every time you wanted to come in.

Reviews.Title: “A great location but a little run down”
Reviews.Author: tmleahey
Reviews.Content: We knew the hotel was supposed to be dark but even with the lights on in our room in the middle of the morning, it was still dark. Our room was spacious enough and desk staff was friendly (not much english). Breakfast was mediocre. Our shower leaked even when we weren't showering. No safe, no frig.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Venice Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JodyKellerman13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment that belongs to Albergo Doni. It was perfect for a family of four with two bedrooms, a kitchen, bathroom with funky shower, and sitting room. It is two minutes from the Piazza San Marcos. What made the experience even better was the incredible helpfulness of Nikos and Tessa, the co-owners of Albergo Doni. They went out of their way to assist us with reinstating return plane reservations that United arbitrarily cancelled. Nikos, especially, was a source of information on food, places to visit off of the beaten track, and special events. He was very patient with our fumbling attempts at Italian. I heartily recommend Albergo Doni and the apartment. Jody Kellerman

Reviews.Title: “Ricky shack, good location and ok price”
Reviews.Author: AirFireWater
Reviews.Content: I guess it is as cheap as it goes in Venice at 60â‚¬ pr night for a double. The hotel is very central, so no reason to stay in more than absolutely necessary. The rooms leave something to be desired (like your own bathroom), and you can hear every move in the hallway. The breakfast was below par, even the coffee (which almost always is excellent in Italy) was bad (almost as bad as the one I get at the office). The hotel is not without charm, it has some old cool furniture you seldom see anywhere else. But I think the rest of the reviews are a bit to nice.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel, Great Staff, Close to the beautiful St. Mark's Square!”
Reviews.Author: Bellanera683
Reviews.Content: I was in Venice for two days to see beautiful Venice and go to the Venecian Festival. My coworker recommended Albergo Doni because she had stayed there almost a year ago. It was a 5 minute walk to St. Mark Sqaure. As soon as you walk out of the doors of this hotel, you are in front of an alley way of water, with gondolas going by. When you go inside, the lighting is dim and cozy; you are greeted by a smiling face (mine was Nikkos). He told me how to get back to the airport when I left, which was my biggest worry since there is no street traffic in Venice (just boats and walking). I asked in advance for a room with a private bath, which was worth the extra $$ for me because I need my privacy in that area. There are not too many creature comforts in the room (TV, refrigerator, clock, etc), but for a short trip, it doesn't matter. It's just a place to sleep and leave your stuff...Venice is the kind of place to get lost in all day and night. Breakfast was typical of the other hotels I stayed in, light, with bread, meats, cheese, coffee, tea, juice and water. Which was fine with me, cause I'm not big on breakfast. However, if you are, may want to just eat out then. The hotel was not luxury, but it was affordable, clean, and very close to the main areas of St. Mark's square and the Vaporretto stops, so I recommend it for those who are looking to explore Venice and especially if you come in town for the Festival!

Reviews.Title: “fantastically located good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmusic1
Reviews.Content: full of charm hotel (lots of old original features) and only a 5 minute walk from st Mark's square. Plus points: very nice room, big bed and wooden floor with plenty of storage space for clothes. The bathroom and toilet (not ensuite) were only just across the hall from our door. Everything was nice and clean. Breakfast is basic but otherwise fine. It is not something I think is essential. Minus points: Like other people have said earlier, rather small towels. Not the fault of hotel at all but got woken up at midnight and 6am by a local loud (church?) bell. Not sure if this was something that happens every day as we were only there for a short time. Staff were helpful and efficient when we asked them any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a cheap getaway.”
Reviews.Author: marybethtopham
Reviews.Content: Albergo Doni is a lovely, if somewhat rickety, Venetian B&B. It is in a fantastic location just minutes from San Marco square and many lovely restaurants. Unfortunately our room looked onto a derelict courtyard but the landings and presumably the rooms at the front had a lovely view onto the canal (and the singing gondoliers!) The staff were kind and welcoming and the breakfast was good. The room was good for the price but there was only one shower for two floors - however we never had to wait to use it.

Reviews.Title: “would go back in a flash!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bamsey
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here for 2 nights and weren't expecting anything too fancy, as we wanted somewhere relatively cheap, so that we had more money to spend out and about enjoying ourselves around Venice. My only prior grievance was that we had to share a bathroom, however, due to the short time we were there, it really was not a problem and it was absolutely spotless. So, considering we only paid 65 euro a night, we were more than happy with this quaint, typical venetian hotel. The locality was more than perfect, tucked away down a little narrow street alongside a litlle canal with the gondolas passing by. It was literally a stone throw away from the water bus stop from the airport, which was bliss, as we arrived 10.30 pm and just wanted to drop our cases off quickly and get out for a snack and this enabled us to be out within 10 mins of arriving!!! The guests who moan and find fault with this hotel should have dug deeper in their pockets and wasted their money on somewhere more expensive with a highter star rating. After all, its only a 1 star, so what does one expect???? The Doni is a 17th Century Palace and I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Venice as we basically only wanted somewhere that was "clean" and "typical", which was exactly what we got! Okay, granted, the pillows were rather firm, but we lost no sleep due to this. We in fact had 2 very good nights of sleep, in fresh, crisp sheets!!! (which I can assure you, I am number 1 fuss pot when it comes to cleanliness). I have to say, if I could have changed anything about this place, it would be the red table covers in the breakfast room. Im sorry, but they were quite depressing. But this was so minor, just me being fussy!!! Top Marks for the Albergo Doni and if your contemplating staying here, go for it, you wont be disappointed!!! (unless your used to luxury hotels with all the mod-cons).

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value!”
Reviews.Author: hdk1026
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo Doni from 7-11 September 2008. It was very easy to find - just a short walk from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop. It is in a perfect location for exploring the San Marco area. The accommodations are not fancy, but clean and comfortable, and an excellent value at â‚¬115 per night. The continental breakfast was adequate and included in the price. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was no air conditioning. It was unusually warm during our stay, and we had a room on the third floor. Thank goodness for the ceiling fan! But, overall, we enjoyed our stay at Albergo Doni. I would definitely recommend it to fellow tourists on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: findley2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location. Only moments from San Marco and just seconds from the vaporetto stop. The best rooms (doubles) have windows that open onto a nearby canal. The single rooms have bathrooms down the hall, but the room has a sink and bidet. The view is over a courtyard that has lots of building supplies in it, but no workers! No A/C, but there is a fan in the room and a plug in for mosquitos! Breakfast is included with the usual Italian sweets, yoghurt, cereal. Coffee only though, no cappuccino. Desk staff was welcoming. A good budget choice. Stayed 4 nights for 50 euro a night, cash only!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: PAULKILLEN
Reviews.Content: Great locationâ€¦.we really booked this because it was cheap. You often get what you pay for and I didnâ€™t realise until we arrived that it was a shared bathroom. (Yes it DID say in the booking confirmation...I just didnâ€™t read it) They DO have some with private bathroom and some with shared. We are not fussy on shared bathroomsâ€¦however after talking to Nickos, the owner, he told us he a had a self catering apartment around the corner for just slightly moreâ€¦.This was absolutely fantastic. Large kitchen, bathroom, lounge a couple of beds with views over one of the canals with occasional gondolier belting out Santa Lucia as they went by!! One downside to both the hotel rooms and the apartment is that the towels are VERY small and there is a clear notice that they are only replaced every TWO days!! I would suggest book by direct email rather than through an agent and ask about the flat.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: viscountesslily
Reviews.Content: Room is adequate, dark, a/c but not central air, bath is small but adequate for showering purposes, reception was pleasant; breakfast was 4.5/10 -roll, cereal, warm milk, cofee, juice, ham, ch; have to drop off key when leaving hotel; good coffee at breakfast; no lift; hotel was easy to find from the vaporetti dock; you can sometimes hear gondoliers coming down the water from the hotel. Within walking distance from St. Mark's square.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: SweetPeaAdventures
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon in Italy in Venice. I really wish we would of stayed more then 2 days here. This city warrants at least 3-4 days if not a week to explore. The hotel was located in a residential area and very quiet. I was amazed at how quiet it was being so close to San Marco Square (Behind). Very close to the vaparreto San Marco station (water taxi). Our room was on the third floor and had a nice view of the canal. The only thing I remember not liking was being woken up at 7am by a gondalier collecting bottles but we did sleep with our windows open. The continental breakfast was ok, nothing memorable, coffee and pastries if I recall. The staff was nice, knowledgable and gave us a map of the island.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT! Large room, great location, friendly hosts”
Reviews.Author: Andre S
Reviews.Content: Our room was huge - I believe it was #18 upstairs, with the en-suite bathroom. A tiny prefab retrofit bathroom, but it had a toilet, shower stall, sink, even a bidet, and I can't complain. The room was large and beautiful - it featured a stunning fresco painted on the ceiling (see my picture for a decent view of it), with a great glass chandelier in the center. The breakfast was advertised as "simple" and therefore I have no complaints - it wasn't much more than a dinner roll and a coffee urn, but this is Italy. You eat real food later in the day. The stairs and hallways have character - by which I mean they creak. Thankfully it never woke us or bothered us once we were inside our room. We really liked this place, and heartily recommend it to anyone except those with stair problems. The hosts were kind, the room clean and large, and we had a nice view of a small canal. No TV? Unexpected but not a big deal. The only real other complaint is the towels. The towels were really bad - small, rough, and seemingly from before I was born. Replace the towels!

Reviews.Title: “inexpensive, quiet place”
Reviews.Author: ivyU_s_a_
Reviews.Content: the managers/owners are very helpful. they let us know how to get to the venice airport for a very early flight for 11 euros each from right around the corner. as we had requested a quiet room, we were in the back altho i think the front was also quiet during this time, even tho on a canal, and on the top floor. no elevator, but the room was quite large with a modern bathroom. it's located very near san marco, which meant that we were able to find our way back much more easily from anywhere in venice. italians don't eat breakfast, yet the hotel provided enough to keep us going for a good stretch of the day, saving a lot of money for americans using the dollar. the biggest drawback was that the room was not well lit at night, so it was difficult to read. during the day the open shutters provide a lot of light.

Reviews.Title: “Room plus Entertainment at no extra Charge”
Reviews.Author: newt-vt
Reviews.Content: We booked the Doni for 3 nights in April and we would go back in a second. Our large room on the 3rd floor (#21) overlooked a canal. In the early evening we were treated to a parade of gondolas, with some gondoliers crooning or playing the accordion. (We even saw a lady fall in!) We spent a great deal of time looking out the window (as my husband said, he was tired and wanted to rest, but he was afraid he would miss something!). We did not have a private bath but it was no problem -- there were only 3 rooms on our floor that shared the toilet, and the shower was downstairs. We never had to wait for either. We would gladly trade the "no bathroom" for the spacious room and view. As others have said, this is an old, very clean hotel with character in a location that can't be beat. Friendly and helpful staff. If you're looking for modern conveniences this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Stayy here!!”
Reviews.Author: LlKPerth
Reviews.Content: Doni made our stay in Venice so memorable!! It is in the perfect location, quiet and calm but just around the corner from all the major attractions. I visited the hotel twice, the second time my friend and I were not staying in Venice for long and the Doni family helped us out, their hospitality and service was great! It was greatly appreciated and we thank you so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: RMSTexas
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Doni. The hotel is located just a couple of minutes from San Marco and in a low traffic area with just a small courtyard beside it and a narrow canal in front. Our room was decent sized with a king sized bed. A bit hard, but we found that to be the case all over Italy. Our room had a pre-fab bathroom in it with a working toilet, sink and shower. Nothing fancy at all, but were more concerned with its location and price. We were in Venice for about 35 hours and spent less then 7 in the hotel. We booked directly by emailing the owner. They were friendly and helped us with directions around Venice and gave us a great walking map that we used to get around. When you go to Venice, do you plan to spend a lot of time in the room? If so, this is NOT the hotel for you. However, if you are looking for budget accomodations right next to the biggest tourist areas in town then I would definately recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gondolier
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay in Venice on route from treviso airport to our camp site in cavelleno. We choose the Doni as it looked just what we wanted and the price was right. The position of the hotel could not be better, just 2 mins from St Marks Square and down a quite side street away from the hustle and bustle. The hotel staff were very helpfull, the breakfast was ok but could have had a little more imagination. The only down side was that we had to change rooms for our second night and had to leave our baggage in the dining room, our second room was not as nice as the first, and we got bitten to death by mossi's. Being an ex palace the features were appealling, liked the nice little Romeo and Juliet style balcony on the first floor over looking the canal. No need to travel far for food the restuarants in San Zaccaria are perfect, one thing to watch out for is the pricey ostaria's (wine bars) stick to the cheap wine from the supermarket. Best way to travel around Venice is to use the vaporetto (water bus), they are great, the number 82 is best gives you a grand tour of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Doni - Not Good”
Reviews.Author: rustyjdcs
Reviews.Content: Rick Steve's recommended this hotel in Venice. When we got there, Venice was experiencing an unprecedented heat wave. The room they had for us was not in the main hotel, but around the corner. The room was a small apartment with 2 bedrooms, kitchen, bathroom and sitting room. Unfortunately, there was no air conditioning and there was a stinky dumpster right underneath our window. The room was hot and musty smelling. We found another hotel that had vacancies and AC and checked out immediately. They still made us pay for the first night. We will never book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MarvLiz
Reviews.Content: A very nice place with a very pleasant and helpful staff. Concierge advised us to maximize the use of our ticket by going here and there and it was all worth it. It's so close to everything. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rustic charm on the verge..”
Reviews.Author: AxleSD
Reviews.Content: If you are sketchy about bathrooms, I recommend requesting your private bathroom. Where cleanliness is blurred with rustic, it is hard to tell where one begins and the other leaves off. I thought the cracking wooden floors and furniture were rustic and gave it charm. My friend thought so too, but we agreed we were happy to not have to share a bathroom. Not disgusting, but not friendly either. It seemed the rooms that shared bathroom would be crowded in the mornings, but then again, we paid a little extra for private. Expect some exercise by using the stairs, as there is no elevator. The bed was comfortable and pillows were of space age foam where they felt heavy and a little sponge-hard. I loved them, but my friend hated them. The location was unbelievably centered but like a good secret. Venice is expensive, get over it and enjoy spending a little more and soak in the charm. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Place with Big Service”
Reviews.Author: Fantastic356
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Friday October 26, 2007 to Sunday October 28, 2007. Had a single room on the 2nd floor (which is equivalent to a 3rd floor in US) Room #16 had a shared bath and did not have a view of the canal. Was originally apprehensive about the shared bath and shared toilet situation but in reality was very pleased with everything. The shared situation did not offer any inconveniences at all. Excellent location, excellent service and great ambience. For the price, no 2-star or even 3-star hotel in Venice can match the location. Re location - the hotel is literally a few steps from St Mark's and also from St Zacarias. One could use the vaporetto stop at St Zacharias or at St Mark.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm ... not sure about this one!”
Reviews.Author: YasmineinSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Doni for 3 nights, 18-21 Sept 07 and I can't in all good conscience recommend this place to anyone. I know it all comes down to expectations, and I don't mind 4 walls, bed, table and chair as long as they are freshly painted, tiled with new doona/bedspread etc and clean. Basic is fine as long as fresh and new. I don't want to go on holidays in a place that is less than the simple standard where I live in Sydney. Doni is not fresh and new. It is a 1700's building (which is fine - it is Venice!) but the interior wallpaper, paint, bedspread, sidetables, chair etc don't look like they have been refurbed since possibly the same time my nanna moved into her first house in Sydney around 1955 (and I am NOT taking about priceless antiques!!). I could see it was clean, but the "oldness" and dirty finger marks all around the door frames, doors etc etc make you feel it is dirty. I have to say this was a real downer on my visit to Venice. I could see that the bathroom fittings have been renovated (ie. toilet, basin etc). The GOOD about Doni is location, location, location!! Directly behind the Daniella ?? hotel, it is PRIME Venetian real estate. You will be hob-nobbing with the Versace wearing tourists heading off to dinner at the finest of waterfront hotels. The other good point was that my room on the 3rd floor DID look over the small canal with the gondolas going past every night at sunset with the most magnificent renditions of "O Solo Mio" (?) and "Feniculi Fenicular" (?) I clapped so hard for the singer and accordian players that my hands were burning! That was tops!! OK - in summary, it was 3/10 of all my hotels on my 28 days in Switzerland and Italy in the EUR65-85 single room price range (I paid EUR65 so bottom end of the deal). If you are desperate to stay for this amount of money, it is OK. I strongly recommend you "suck it up" to coin a Sydney phrase, and realise Venice is one of the worlds top 5 most expensive cities, and pay the EUR100+ to stay somewhere a bit more fresh OR, stay a bit away from S.Marco ie. maybe Lido or Accademia Bridge area - nowhere is too far away in Venice - Rialto and Accademia Bridges are really only 15 mins walk from S.Marco Square (provided you don't stop and look at all the shops inbetween!!) The funny thing is that if the manager/owner was a bit more welcoming or interested in my stay, I probably would have thought a little better of the place (kinda' like visiting your nanna's place), but he just wanted to make sure I paid in cash when I left and that I could be out by 8.30am - and that's all he cared about. He was not rude, just money hungry for his cash. Ce la vie ... Please also note the breakfast was simple cereal, very average filter coffee, rubbery rolls that tasted like those lovely airline tennis balls, jam and tomato juice. It was OK if you are hungry. I would not go back or recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Doni in the heart of beautiful Venice!”
Reviews.Author: oldrabbit
Reviews.Content: The Albergo Doni is close to St. Mark's Square and all major attractions in Venice. It sits alongside a small canal - all of which suited our needs well. BUT - in my mind, travel is not only about the buildings but about PEOPLE - and Nikos, Tessa and their aunt Gina are wonderful people as well as excellent hosts! We felt so very comfortable staying with them! Tessa had her wonderful young children visiting "Aunt Gina" while we were in the lobby - and Tessa's Brother Nikos helped us with all our questions and needs. Great family, great old hotel, and an excellent location. BTW - for an EXCELLENT meal while there, walk to Antica Sacrestia, and enjoy! Pino, the owner, is very good at managing his restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great small family run hotel in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: byoung3rd
Reviews.Content: I have given this hotel four stars because it does what it does so well. There is no pretense here. I'm talking value....the rooms are big by Venice standards (comparing to hotels 2 or 3 times as expensive)...the location is a rare "front row" premium spot within minutes of Piazza San Marcos and less than a block from the Grand Canel. Everything about the hotel is charming, including the noise from the Restaurant in the evening....(doesn't bother those of us who are dancing in San Marcos square every night)...but the greatest attribute of the Doni is the family that runs the hotel....very personable and very attentive to their guests....most of the staff is good with English, so that helps when you need advice on anything. A tip for those looking for good food....you don't have to go too far...right across the first bridge on the way to San Marcos is a small restaurant (almost under the steps) that caters to the Gondoliers and other locals (as well as tourists in the know)...you will find the food good and the staff generally fun.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: MikemckIndiana_USA
Reviews.Content: This small hotel was better than expected. We're told that most rooms are very small but our room (#8) was huge with terrazzo floor, frescoed ceiling and glass chandelier. It knocked us over when we opened the door. The building is a 17th century 'palace' and, like everything in Venice, it shows its age but you'll find it very clean. The washroom was small but clean and everything worked fine. Location was super with St Marks, good restaurants, vaparretto station, ect. just a short walk away. The host and his staff were very nice and always helpful. All and all, a good value and a pleasant experience that exceeded our expectations. We would return if ever back in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: MarcC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo Doni for three nights in May of 2007. It's a one star hotel and it looks it. The floors creak, the doors are crooked and the rooms are a bit run-down. Our room was on the second floor at the back of the Hotel. The room was immense. They would normally put 4 people in there but they gave it to us as a double. The ceiling had to be 4-5 metres (12-15 ft) high and it was adorned by a Fresco and a Murano glass chandelier. All of which could have used a bit of cleaning and/or painting. The en-suite bathroom had been added as a box with an 8 foot ceiling to a corner of the room. It was very modern, clean and fully functional. Our room looked over a restaurant terrace and it was a bit noisy until 11:00 pm when the place closed up. The Hotel was on a small canal 5 minutes walk to Piazza San Marco and the vaporetto stop on the Grand canal. The breakfast was standard stuff but the coffee was abundant and the breakfast room had pictures of the hotel after the big flood of 1966. The staff was very friendly and helpful with Vaporetto schedules and booking a concert for us. Altogether a great place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Vampire hunting!!!”
Reviews.Author: ninja28
Reviews.Content: Hello!!! We are a family with a teenage child, we stayed in Venice for 3 nights. I choose this hotel after consulting many travel blog/guides. In fact this hotel have a very good location and reasonable price for Venice. But I was wrong with the reasonable price, since I have to pay not only with money, but also with my family blood. When I was young I saw a movie called "VAMPIRE IN VENICE", and in this case, it takes the form of an insect (gnat/mosquito). Our room have a private bathroon, good size, and nice in the first aproach.But if you look carefully, you will find some marks ( 6+) in their white wall and curtains, and proves that others "VAN HELSING" hunted here... I was forced to HUNT FOR 3 NIGTHS, and even after crushing +7 enemies per nights, they were still coming and feeding in this battle arena. I closed all the windows and we used anti-mosquito spray, but it was useless. Breakfast was bad, they should serve real coffe and decent breads (they are in Itay, they have this obligation).In fact I have noticed during beakfast, that the other guests had bites marks too. Beware of this hunted hotel/castle, and "RICK STEVE" shame on you, for leading inocent victims to this trap...you should change your name to IGOR!!! :-{

Reviews.Title: “Hotel hostesses were wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: BellaItalia2007
Reviews.Content: The women who run this hotel were so very hospitable and accomodating to my husband and myself. I became ill during my stay in Venice, and needed to see a doctor immediately. Being an American, I didn't have any idea how to go about finding/speaking with/paying a physician in Italy, and was worried about the process. One of the sweet women who works here spent her entire morning calling all of the doctors in the phone book, in her personal directory, and that other people knew of, in an attempt to make an appointment for me. She persisted until she found one with an opening, and she then proceeded to translate my symptoms to the doctor in Italian, so that when I arrived at his office, he already knew why I was there, and was able to prescribe medication. These women were willing, during our entire stay, to go out of their way to make our trip the most enjoyable and profitable it could be. We highly recommend this "albergo!"

Reviews.Title: “So Close to St. Mark's!”
Reviews.Author: apoge_31
Reviews.Content: I was looking for decent, affordable accomodations in Venice convenient to St. Mark's Square and the Doni satisfied all my needs. Though you do have to leave your key at the front desk, I often struck up a conversation with the friendly staff, and since I was alone for two days before my friends met me there, it was very nice to feel included. Breakfast is light (rolls and coffee), but it was enough for me to get started for the day, since I prefer to eat outside the hotel to better experience the local cuisine. It's not easy to find the hotel, though I suppose nothing in Venice is, but by the end of my stay, I had discovered several different ways to get back to the Doni. I also didn't mind getting lost in Venice, since it's often brought me to places only locals or other lost souls had discovered.

Reviews.Title: “Best Apt.ever”
Reviews.Author: MaryroseCalifornia
Reviews.Content: While Hotel Doni was unable to accommodate us for the required dates Nickos suggested an Apt. imin from the hotel. Such luxury. It was completely refurbished and could accommodate 6 people. Fully equiped and overlooked one of the main canals for the Gondolas. We sat in our window and listened to them every evening. We were 1 min. from St. Marks Sq. in the heart of throbbing Venice. Every day maid service. We have never experienced suc h luxury at such an affordable price. Highly recommend. Mary & Tom Rose , California

Reviews.Title: “Very charming, in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Denmark
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful vacation in the ancient Venice. My stay at the Doni fullfilled all my needs. It is located in the heart of Venice, only 3 minutes walk from the infamous San Marco Square. Albergo Doni is a small and cosy family-owned hotel decorated in the authentic originial Venice-style. The hotel is simple, but very clean and safe. It is very charming and from the window you can enjoy the gondolas sailing in the romantic canals. The price is very affordable and Doni gives very good value for money. They claim to be only a one-star hotel. Personally I would rate this hotel higher - maybe 2-3 stars. My week in Venice was like a dream came true.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not worth it...”
Reviews.Author: MauiBug
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Doni for 2 nights in June07. First the good: The location is great, right near st.marks and around lots of good restaurants. The bathroom was clean but there was little to no water pressure at all. The bad: The sheets had a small stain on them, and the breakfast was hardly a breakfast at all. It was only a roll and some jelly. The room was tiny and HOT which wouldn't be bad except that the bed was also creaky and old and the mattress sunk in, in the middle. My biggest problem was that everyone is required to leave their key downstairs on a hook at by the door when leaving the hotel. But there is never anyone watching the keys and the front door is always open, so anyone has access to any room if they want. The hotel has a sign in every room saying they are not responsible if anything gets stolen in the room. This hotel is not cheap enough to have such a run down decor. I would stay here only if you have very low standards.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have found a better place!!!”
Reviews.Author: susanina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doni's for three days in June and really liked it a lot! First of all because it's located in the very heart of Venice. It's only a three minutes walk to the St Marcus Square, and also the vaporetto stop San Zaccaria is very close, so getting to the hotel and back to the airport was very easy even with the big and heavy luggage we had. From our nice and spacious antique Venetian-style bedroom we had a fantastic view over a romantic canal, where you could even see pass the gondolas, which was especially nice in the evening when the gondoliere would sing their serenades. The room was very clean as was the shared toilet/bathroom which was located on the same floor and available whenever we needed it. The breakfast was typical Italian, that is quite simple, but you could eat as much as you liked from the buffet and the coffee was the tipical strong Italian expresso - very delicious!!! So for the price we paid we couldn't have desired more. The staff was always very friendly, they all spoke good English and were always available, providing us with useful information. To put it in a nutshell: We can only recommend this nice family run hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst breakfast we have ever been offered!”
Reviews.Author: PLJDerbyshire_UK
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels we have ever stayed in! Room 22 on the third floor needs a complete revamp - peeling wallpaper, dark wood paneling, terrible old furniture. The air conditioning unit consisted of a machine with a large tube which had to exit through an open window - result we stayed cool but were bitten to death on the first night! The bathroom had been redone and was nice. The breakfast was awful! Cornflakes, bread rolls and jam/Nutella, the worst coffee ever and cold into the bargain, all served in a very dingy dining room. Location is certainly not everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, A few trade-offs though”
Reviews.Author: HD1989
Reviews.Content: This little one-star hotel is in a great location only a couple minute walk to San Marco Square and right by a the water bus stop which makes for easy access to everything. It was also at a great price for Venice, 65 euro/night. I had a single room facing the canal on the 3rd floor, with a shared toilet across the hall and shared shower down 2 flights. The room was clean and quaint and the windows open onto a canal. The only trade-off (as mentioned in a few reviews I read) was the noise level late at night. The gondaliers go through the little canal outside the building which can be endearing, but also loud if you are trying to sleep at 10 or 11pm. The street vendors also drag their metal carts/racks down the canal late at night. To top it off there was construction a couple of buildings down, starting at 7am the last few mornings, which echoes in the canal. The staff were very friendly and willing to help me with a lost luggage situation. Overall it was an okay stay, but I would not suggest it in the heat of the summer since the rooms don't have air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: QuigsCalif
Reviews.Content: We booked the Albergo Doni and upon arrival were told, because of the neighbor's construction, we were to have a room somewhere over a small bridge and down the lane. It was up some skanky stairway behind two locked doors. I believe they called it the Leoncini. Our room was large with a small kitchenette and bathroom. No toilet paper or soap. At first I thought the towels were dirty but they smelled clean, just a bit rough. The view from the bathroom window was a cruddy old pipe that the pigeons rested on. The view from the bedroom wasn't much better, but if you looked hard enough you could see a bit of the canal a bit a ways. One plus was the location, being so close to St. Marcs square. But, if I were to do it again, I would spend just a bit more and be a little bit further away. I think you can get more bang for your buck a block or two away and walking those extra blocks is the best part of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Alan and Susan”
Reviews.Author: alanvac
Reviews.Content: Our recent Italian vacation which included hotel stays in Rome, Florence and Venice was topped off with a wonderful stay at a flat belonging to the hotel Albergo DONI in Venice. The flat was very roomy, had clean Italian decorated cement floors and was located on the second floor â€“ all of the normal hotel rooms were full during our mid April visit. The flat was a nice change of pace from the normally cramped European hotel rooms. The flat was conveniently located only a couple of minutes walk form San Marco Plaza and very quiet. It was amazing how quickly you could remove yourself from the daily influx of crowded tourist sights and have some privacy and the amenities of home. Mid April was unusually warm and did not warrant anything more than a light jacket. We certainly got the better deal as Abergo DONI was the least expensive, per night stay, of all our Italian hotels. Breakfast was not included but this was a minor detail as delis, cappuccino bars, patio restaurants, internet center and even a pharmacy were conveniently located just outside of the flatâ€™s exterior door. For us it was a total immersion into the Italian lifestyle. We enjoyed our stay immensely - this hotel is definitely worth returning to! Alan and Susan, California

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great room”
Reviews.Author: memorizingmo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Albergo Doni for two nights and were very happy. We had a room over the canal as well. Older building, some peeling wallpaper and other rough-around-the-edges bits, but good furniture, romantic "feel," and helpful, friendly staff. It was exactly what we had wanted -- why go to an old city like Venice and stay in something that resembles a U.S. chain hotel? In reference to the previous poster's comments -- my husband also was bitten multiple times, and the mosquitos that did it were in plain sight on the ceiling! We decided after the first night that even though we liked having the windows open, it would be better to close them and keep out the mosquitos. We had a shared bath, but there was never a wait and the guy at the front desk told us when we checked in that if there ever was one, a shower and toilet were also available on the first floor for our use. (I suspect that someone actually lives in the hotel, since I smelled food cooking on a couple of occasions.) Breakfast and towels were sparse, but I had read a lot of comments about the small towels and small breakfasts in Italy and had come prepared. The only other potential problem: It was rather loud outside, but sometimes the noise was singing gondoliers : ) Maybe light sleepers should ask for a room that doesn't have a canal view?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Affordable Stay with a View- and the requisite crazy Italian owner”
Reviews.Author: BlueBear92
Reviews.Content: Down a tiny alley just steps from San Marco, the Albergo Doni is a affordable gem in the hart of Venice. I would recommend it without any reservations, and hope to stay there in the future. I chose the Doni (Albergo roughly translates to "nicer, but still cheap hotel" in Italian) because with them I was able to get a canal-view room for a price I could afford. Their website doesn't do much for me: the images are of dark, crowded rooms with frighteningly crimson beds. As we carried our bags from the Vaporetti station to the nearby Doni, I warned my partner not to expect much. I was in for a suprise. From the busy quay, we turned down a narrow alley (so narrow that despite reading up on Venice ahead of time, I thought it was *just* an alley) and walked a hundred yards before finding ourselves walking alongside a peaceful canal. The Doni is situated in an old building, and the the rooms go up all the way to the top (warning: room twenty-one entails three flights of stairs!) We were greeted wood paneling and Mozart, as well as Nico, whose friendly correspondence via email had convinced me to give the Doni a try. Nico told us that though we would have our first two nights in the room we'd booked, we would have to move on the last night for a previous reservation. That was a bit of a disappointment, but ok. We surrendered our passports, and climbed up to room 5. Room 5 is large by European standards and huge by Venetian standards, big enough to fit three beds in it with room to spare. The bed was great- comfortable with some of the best linen I've had in Europe (I typically stay at cheaper places) It came with a bidet, sink, and a wardrobe. But the real prize were the double windows which opened out over the canal, complete with the colored glass rondels famous in Northern Italy. I threw them open and propped my elbows on the ledge for a perfect view of the canal, nearby bridges, and a small yellow canary singing in the barred window opposite me. It was heaven. Actually, our whole stay at the Doni was pretty great. Breakfast was good for Italy; plenty of coffee and hot milk, corn flakes, jam and nutella, rolls, and some frightening juice we steered clear of. The hotel has a night guard and the door is always locked, but a quick buzz will generally summon the gatekeeper quickly. One amusing note: I noticed I was getting bitten by something in Venice. On the second day, the welts had only gotten bigger, so I thought I'd ask Nico if there were mosquitos in the area, and if so, where I could get an insect repellant. Nico thought we were accusing his hotel of being unclean. He insisted on looking at my bites and loudly protected that they weren't insect bites, I must have been scratching myself. We headed up to our room for a nap, but Nico wasn't done. After about twenty minutes, there was a knock on the door. I was sleepy (and in a nightshirt) so I dispatched my partner to deal with it. Nico was back for round two. He insisted vociferously (I'd even call it yelling) that there were NO BUGS in his hotel; my soft-spoken partner tried to calm him down, apologized, assured him that we didn't think anything of the sort, but Nico thundered on for a few minutes, telling us that we could see his complaint book if we didn't believe him! It was an entertaining end to our stay in Venice, though the mystery of the Venician biting insects still lives on. Highly recommended hotel- I definitely plan to return. For economy, comfort, and location, the Albergo Doni cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: anonymousk
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed there last week. Since we live about 750 miles apart, we don't often get to see each other . And even though we are in our 50's, we can still give way to irrepressable fits of laughter. We didn't realize that our room was above the family kitchen the first night and one of the staff came and knocked on our door. So we tried to whisper the rest of the time. The location was great, but returning from somewhere other than San Zaccaria could be somewhat confusing. The staff was pleasant but the breakfast was only rolls, cereal, juice and coffee which was fine for us but some might want more. Ours was a very small room for two with luggage but we did have a private bath.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxRox
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week during my stint in Italy. It was nothing special except the location was great. We were close to the water taxi stop (2 actually) and just a very short walk to San Marco Square. The breakfast that is included is typical Italian and not what Americans expect. Get there early, or the rolls are all gone. Would I stay here again? Probably not. I would look for someplace a little nicer in around the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: TrevorTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: Albergo Doni is in a perfect locations just a few minutes off of S. Marco and yet very quiet. We paid â‚¬ 90 for a double room with a private bathroom, which I believe is an excellent price. The bathroom was small and probably added on at some point in the 80ies, but it was clean and everything worked well. The room is simple but spacious and the wooden floor is just gorgeous. Breakfast wasn't exciting, but truth be told, it hardly ever is in Italy. In sum I definitely recommend Albergo Doni and would stay there again! I believe it is hard to find another place that spacious and clam in a such convenient location in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerGuys
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Albergo Doni for two nights included a room that overlooked a fantastic canal (gondolas went by under our open window!) and a price that left us with money for the great Italian food. With a minute's walk to St. Mark's Square, this hotel made us feel like local residents, and the friendly staff made us feel at home as well. The vapoeretta stop was also a minute away.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Doni - A Perfect Place!”
Reviews.Author: Melinda333
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend Albergo Doni to anyone wanting a perfectly located, comfortable, clean, and fun place to stay while in Venezia. We have stayed here four times and have recommended this hotel to several friends. There's a reason - it's a perfect place! The hotel has cozy wood floors, stairs covered with colorful carpets, a cheerful and inviting breakfast room, and the best staff anyone could ask for! The family members who run the hotel are more like friends - always helpful, cheerful, and friendly. The hotel is perfectly located - not far from Piazza San Marco, but not in the midst of the hubbub. Situated on a small canal, the best entertainment ever is leaning out your room window (#3, 12, or 21) and watch the gondolas drift by in the evening, often including music and song! I highly recommend Albergo Doni if you go to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant refuge”
Reviews.Author: nicolla
Reviews.Content: Not only booking was convenient at Albergo Doni, staying there was comfortable and relaxing. Situated close to Pza. San Marco this small hotel is quiet and just off the main-stream. It is located at a small channel in an old Venitian buliding. Our bedroom was large (especially if you compare it to the tiny hotel rooms, Venice usually offers), everything was clean and tidy, breakfast was satisfactory. But most of all staff and owners are really friendly and helpful. Staying there made a few days of Venice in the heat of july recreative and very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice location”
Reviews.Author: Dagnini21
Reviews.Content: What a location! Hotel is on a tiny canal and just a block from the Grand Canal, a very short walk from the Doge's Palace: take Vaporetto to San Zaccaria stop, walk over foot bridge, turn into alley just along left side of Hotel Savoia&Jolanda and follow Cal del Vin along to Hotel Doni on the tiny canal, just wide enough for two gondolas to pass. The hotel staff is friendly and the Doni is charming and very clean. There are separate rooms in hallway for toilet and shower. We felt as if we had the floor to ourselves, though we saw other guests in the breakfast room. Ceiling fans kept our room comfortable. Our room had a sink and a bidet. Another in our party had a single room which had a large table fan instead of a ceiling fan. It is a very pleasant small hotel and quite reasonably priced. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved our stay at Doni. The location really can't be beat. It's right on a small canal, and it's really close to San Marco. After dancing in Piazza San Marco, we were able to quickly run back and get our camera, then resume the evening. Some reviews have mentioned that it's hard to find, but we didn't find that was the case. However, to the uninitiated, everything in Venice is hard to find. But it is very close to the San Zaccharia vaporetto (water bus) stop. The gentleman who worked the front desk (his name may have been Nicolo) was very friendly. Spoke perfect English. He gave us maps, directions, and recommendations. Also helped us sort out a mistake we made in booking the accommodations. My wife had apprehensions about the shared bathroom. (many rooms do not have bathroom en suite). Our room had a sink that met our needs (and a bidet). There were separate shower and bath rooms down the hall. They were clean and available when we needed them. The room was sufficiently large. (bigger than we expected). The place was a little creeky, but I think most places in Venice are that way. Notes: no elevator, no TV. Cash only. Continental breakfast included. Rick Steve's recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, but we loved our room with a view”
Reviews.Author: immaculate_itinerant
Reviews.Content: We were able to book a last minute room at the Doni for Easter weekend at a great rate. As we really weren't expecting much, we were very pleasantly surprised by our charming old-world style room with a canal view. There were absolutely no frills - no TV, no bathroom, and awful towels that we first mistook for oversized cloth napkins. However, this was all made up for by the good price, unbeatable location, and charm of our room with a view. The bathroom was average and kept reasonably clean, and we didn't really have problems with waiting for the shower. Breakfast was extremely basic, consisting of breads that appeared to be left over dinner rolls, a selection of warm beverages and juice, yogurt, and cereal, which I discovered to contain a few live ants. Considering the price we paid in the midst of high season, as well as the great room we lucked out with, the Doni was an excellent deal. However, I think we may not have been quite as pleased if we had stayed in a room without the canal view. The location was incredible, literally around the corner from San Marco square, and just a few steps from the vaporetto stop. It was a bit hard to find at first, as you have to walk down the little alleyway called Calle del Vin, then turn left at the end and turn right again, and there is the hotel facing the canal. The Doni is certainly no luxury hotel, but it was worth the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: TravelNovice
Reviews.Content: What I had to keep reminding myself of was the fact that we were paying substanially less than what it would have cost to stay elsewhere in Venice. If you are traveling on a budget and you need an inexpensive place to stay, this place will certainly do. On the postivie side, the guy who runs the place is really great and the location can't be beat! Other than that, it's completely no-frills. I had to keep reminding myself, "You get what you pay for." And in Venice, to stay somewhere nicer, you'd have to pay a whole lot more. Breakfast consisted of bread, butter, juice, cereal and coffee. The towels were hard, wrinkled sheets (you know, when you take a soaking wet towel, wring it out as tight as you can and then air dry it without fabric softner...). The beds in our room were not more than springs but the ones in our friends room were better. There are no TVs in the room. And most rooms do not have a private bathroom. It's a shared bath in the hallway. The thing I had the hardest time with was the shared bathroom. The bathrooms were very clean at 9:00 pm when I gave my kids a shower before bed. But when I woke up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom I about killed myself slipping on the floor...a rude awakening at 3:00 am! And in the morning when I went down the hall to shower I was pretty grossed out. Now I shower at my gym so common showers don't usually gross me out. But the body hair all over from the previous user caused me to turn my nose up. Mine may have been an unusual circumstance but with a shared bathroom you just never know what you'll get! Would I stay there again? Personally, probably not. Would I recommend it to someone who was traveling on a tight budget? Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: newyorksnork
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this review is based on my stay and is all relative. This is not The Plaza, but for what it is I have to say I was impressed. At the last minute my wife and I decided to visit Venice, I searched for days for a resonable priced hotel room during the busy Easter weekend and had a tough time finding one that was close, clean and charming (the only other option I found had terrible reviews). The room we got was the only one available in the hotel and had a shared bath. The shared bath was not my choice because my wife is a stickler for cleanliness, but surprisingly it was extremely clean and caused no problems at all. The room was bare bones, possessing a certain charm that is missing in most hotels. Our room overlooked the canal allowing us to spend our mornings and evenings with a great view without any walking needed. The staff was fantastic. All workers were very friendly and accomedating - all times of the day. The only criticisms are 1) the breakfast - very basic, not worth waiting around for if you are an early bird 2) the pillows were very dense - I actually loved them, not my wife though - I guess it is a matter of personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Doni”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel and it's great location. It is just off the San Marco Square. It is a uniquely Venetian experience the owner was extremely helpful to my wife and myself. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the budget traveller.”
Reviews.Content: In general the good was location, staff, price, quaintness The bad was... noise (not from the outside but on the inside you could hear everything your neighbors were doing) and the smell of the canal. The time that we went, it was like staying beside an open sewer. But we couldn't smell it inside the hotel unless we opened the window.
